articles.title: About this site
articles.description: The website provides the applications' links and tutorials of the data tools developed by Water Stewarship Team (WST).

articles.title: Tutorial series--Area Comparison
articles.contents:
Area comparison tool can detect the difference of area in base case and application base.
Step 1. Select the CPUs
The tool is able to use parallel running (multiple cores) to speed up the calculation. Usually, one core would take charge of the calculation in one watershed. Therefore, the recommend CPUs number is equal to the number of selected watersheds.
Step 2. Upload the base- and application-case waste rock
Upload the area input files to base case and application case
Step 3. Select watersheds
Please select watersheds
Step 4. Enter comparison tolerance
Above comparison tolerance (i.e., abs|base case-application case|) would be regarded as difference.

articles.title: Tutorial series--EQuals
articles.contents:
Pre-treatment
EQuals compilation tool is designed for .xlsx file which is less than 50 MB. If you have a bigger data set, please reach out to me directly.
Step 1. Upload the files
Please the Browse section to upload your EQuals.xlsx file.
Step 2. Select the fraction
Fraction value is used to compile the repeated samples at the same time step which have both “above detection”(i.e., above detection limit) and “non-detection”(i.e., lower than detection limit). The equation is as below:
\[
Y_{final~value}=X_{above~dection}+\alpha_{fraction}×X_{non~detction}
\]
Step 3. Select SYS_LOC_CODE (nodes)
The option of nodes would be auto-generated after uploading your EQuals file. You can select multiple nodes if you need process more than one nodes.
Step 4. Select chemicals (constituents)
The option of constituents would be auto-generated after uploading your EQuals file. The tool processed the constituents which are in our list. In other words, flows, temperature and etc. would be removed in the option.
Step 5. Select time step
The tool provides the option to convert the daily average to weekly, monthly and yearly average. If you need some customized statistical methods, please reach out to me.
Step 6. Process the data
After selecting all above sections, press the “Process” button to start processin your data.
Step 7. Download the dataset
This tool allows to download the processed data. If you press the button, you may need to wait a couple of minutes to get the new windows to select download location in your PC, because the backstage is busy in processing the data.
Step 8. Visualize the processed data
After processing the data, a new section would appear which allows users to visulize the process data in this tool. Now, the tool supports ONE node with mutiple consituents.

articles.title: Online tools
articles.description: We provide the waste rock & areas comparison and EQuals compilation tools. Now, the website is still in buidling. More data tools (e.g., flows comparison, Python GUI control for GoldSim) and related tutorials are coming!
articles.contents:
If you are a new user, please read the tutorial articles by clicking top right tab of tutorials.
Waste Rock Input File Comparison Tool (version 1.1)
Area comparison tool (version 1)
EQuals compilation tool (version 2)

articles.title: Tutorial series--Waste Rock Comparison
articles.contents:
Waste rock (WR) comparison tool can auto detect the ranges of each waste rock categories (e.g., cumulative, yearly and etc.).
Step 1. Upload the base- and application-case waste rock
Upload the WR input files to base case and application case
Step 2. Select watershed
Please selet one of four watersheds
Step 3. Enter categories
Please enter the categories of WR. It is noted that, users need to check if there is select categories in BOTH WR input files. If one input file does not contain the selected category, the tool would return an error.
Step 4. Enter percentage
The tool use percentage to tell whether there is difference between the base case and application case. It is noted that, if WR in case was zero while application values were non-zero, the percentage would be 100%. The equation of percentage is shown as below:
\[
                 WR_{Application~base}-WR_{Base~case}\over WR_{Base~case}
\]
Step 5. Enter column range and row of RWQM ID
Please enter the range of headers in WR input file. For example, in FRO the range of headers in Excel sheet is A7:AY7. So, enter “A:AY”to column range and “7” to row range.
Step 6. Process & download data and visualization
Press “Process Data”. After processing the tables, users can download the results as a .CSV file. A new section would appear at the sidebar, users can select one categories to visualize the processed data. For cumulative WR, the tool provide area plot while rest of plot are lollipop plots.
